## Chapter 1 Letter to Shareholders

Dear shareholders,

Due to geopolitical tensions, inflation, the pandemic, and wars in 2023, facing numerous unfavorable external factors, the global demand for business has fallen behind expectations. This situation has also had an impact on the operation of AcBel Polytech. However, we have also seen hidden important opportunities. At this time of fluctuation, we actively transformed to improve our adaptability, strengthen internal management, enhance product competitiveness, and ensure that we can flexibly respond to market fluctuations, and we would like to report to all shareholders AcBel's operating results in 2023 and business outlook for 2024.

## 2023 Operating Results

AcBel Polytech. achieved a consolidated revenue of $27,845 million for the entire year of 2023, an increase of 12.33% compared to the previous year of $24,789 million. The revenue has been growing continuously for six years. Due to one-time expenses and amortization generated by the acquisition of overseas targets, the consolidated net income before tax was $45.79 thousand, and EPS was $0.07.

The successful acquisition of the former ABB Power Conversion Division (now OmniOn Power) at the beginning of last year injected growth momentum into AcBel's revenue in the second half of the year. In the second half of the year, both parties have engaged in strategic cooperation in aspects of procurement, business, research and development, and manufacturing. We can expect this cooperation to generate a comprehensive effect of one plus one greater than two, and ensure that we continue to create value in this time of uncertainty.

The revenue of the power supply industry was lower than expected, mainly due to the dual impact of sluggish overall demand for consumer power supplies in the terminal market and  customer  inventory  adjustments,  resulting  in  sales  performance  below  expectations. Although there was a slight growth in demand for fuel cells and network communication products for enterprise power supplies, the revenue performance remained unchanged from last year. In addition, the telecommunications power supply business from OmniOn Power not only adds new customer groups to the company, but also brings a considerable degree of revenue contribution. In terms of overall consolidated revenue, the merger with OmniOn Power still leads to a historic high in revenue for the power supply industry.

In response to the global trend of net zero carbon emissions and revolutionary changes in transportation methods, it has become an inevitable trend for vehicles to switch from fuel internal combustion engines to electric power drives. AcBel has been deeply involved in the field of electric energy conversion for vehicles for many years and successfully won key electric module orders from international electric vehicle manufacturers in 2023. In addition, AcBel has collaborated with the largest charging station partner in the United States, from design to manufacturing,  and  has  a  key  position  as  a  Total  Solution  in  the  entire  electric  vehicle ecosystem.

Since last year, the new energy industry has launched a new business model of light asset to  service  conversion,  no  longer  just  building  solar  power  plants,  but  transforming  into managers of solar power plants. Through the joint venture with the life insurance industry, 'AcSun  Energy  Inc.'  has  launched  a  continuous  operation  with  asset  management  and maintenance services as the main axis, which has brought great revenue injection.

Under  market  tightening,  the  metal  stamping  industry  significantly  increased  its automation equipment ratio last year to improve production efficiency and quality. Despite facing market challenges for the year 2023, profits remained at a certain level.

## Business Environment and Development Strategy

The Company has been committed to practicing ESG in multiple fields for a long time. In the year of 2023, it has won the 'Taiwan's Top 100 Sustainability Model Corporate Award in Comprehensive Sustainability Performance Category' for 2 consecutive years, and has been awarded the 'Platinum Award for Electronic Information Manufacturing in the Category 1 Sustainability  Report'  for  9  consecutive  years.  In  addition,  the  achievements  in  carbon management were also highly recognized. It won the '2023 ESG (Carbon Management) Award' awarded by SGS and was praised by the media as the top three enterprises with the most progress in carbon reduction. This year is the ample harvest of AcBel Polytech's ESG achievements! These honors represent the Company's commitment to the environment and will continue to lead the Company in achieving its vision of "providing efficient and clean energy solutions, becoming a sustainable positive cycle of energy" through outstanding ESG practices in the future.

## Operating outlook for the year of 2024

This  year  marks  the  implementation  of  AcBel's  transformation.  Despite  external uncertainties such as overall economic and geopolitical factors, we are actively improving our competitiveness in changing markets. AI applications and the electric vehicle market will be

important areas for our technological strategic layout; the rapid development of AI technology has brought important changes to the technology industry, and the increasing popularity of electric vehicles and strict environmental regulations have reshaped the industry chain of the automotive market. These two markets have brought huge demand for products, and also require us to increase our efforts in technology, market promotion, and cooperation. We need to flexibly adjust our business models to create more growth opportunities, thereby bringing positive operational prospects to the Company.

The  comprehensive  effect  of  merging  OmniOn  Power's  strategy  will  gradually demonstrate benefits in the year of 2024, especially in the development of high wattage products, which will help AcBel enter the 5G and AI server field, increase the proportion of revenue in enterprise power supply, and expand the depth and breadth of its product line. By strengthening  product  portfolio  and  deepening  customer  cooperation,  adjusting  product proportion year by year, increasing the proportion of data centers, high-end servers, and automotive power products, and strengthening the application of enterprise power products, we hope to further expand our market share and competitive advantage in the field of enterprise power through this strategy.

The  year  of  2024  is  an  important  time  point  for  the  implementation  of  AcBel transformation. We thank all customers, employees, shareholders, and partners for their support. Looking forward to the future, AcBel will uphold the core concept of sustainable development and work together with all employees to create sustainable value for the enterprise.

Wish all shareholders. Good health and good luck.

AcBel Polytech Inc.

Chairman: Hsu Chieh-Li

Manager: Hsu Chieh-Li

Chief Accountant: Chen Chien-Nan

## Chapter 2 Company Profile

AcBel  was  established  on  July  29,  1981,  with  the  business  philosophy  of  'Innovation, Harmony, and Transcendence', AcBel insists on continuous technological innovation and business expansion, and with power management technology as the core axis, AcBel has become a world-class manufacturing partner, and is now one of the world's top ten leading companies in the power supply industry.

Starting from the sales of domestic and overseas electronic components, we have gradually developed into a specialized manufacturer dedicated to the collaborative design and production of switching power supplies. Our main services include 'Power Supply Solutions', 'Intelligent Green Energy Services' and 'Electric Power Solutions'.

In the field of 'Power Supply Solutions', we mainly produce power supply products for consumer and enterprise applications. After the successful acquisition of the former ABB Power Conversion Division (now OmniOn Power) in 2023, we have further strengthened our comprehensive deployment in the power supply industry by combining its technological strength and product lines in the telecom power supply industry.

As the issue of global warming becomes increasingly serious, AcBel actively responds to the trend of energy saving and carbon reduction as well as government policies, and actively expands into emerging fields such as green energy and electric vehicles in recent years. Leveraging on its decades-long foundation in power supply, AcBel has successfully entered into the field of electric vehicles, with the scope of application extending from inside to outside of the vehicle. In the face of ESG requirements in Europe and the United States and the growing demand for renewable energy, AcBel rapidly promotes green power trading platforms to meet the market demand for green power and provide green power transfer services for corporate customers. In the future, AcBel's energy storage technology will be used to achieve the goals of intelligent energy aggregation and dispatching and diversified energy development.

AcBel's global R&D headquarters is located in Taiwan, and now we have added professional R&D teams in the U.S. and other places to keep abreast of the latest market trends and conduct forward-looking technology research and product development oriented to customer needs, and we are committed to providing high-value products that meet the market demands. Our manufacturing bases are located in Taiwan, China, the Philippines, and Mexico. Based on customer demand and industry changes, we will expand our production capacity in a timely manner and promote precision manufacturing to satisfy the needs of customers around the world.

## 5. Board diversity and independence:

The Company's current Board of Directors is composed of 12 Directors, including four Independent  Directors.  The  nomination  and  selection  of  the  board  members  shall  be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, adopting the candidate nomination system, in compliance with the 'Election Procedures of Directors' and the  'Corporate  Governance  Practice  Principles',  so  as  to  ensure  the  diversity  and independence of Directors.

## (1) Board diversity

Except for the number of Directors who are concurrently managers of the Company shall not exceed one-third of all Directors, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be determined based on the Company's business operations, operating dynamics, and development needs. The policy should include, without being limited to, the following two general standards:

- A. Basic requirements and values: Gender, age, nationality, and culture.
- B.  Professional knowledge and skills: A professional background (e.g., finance, accounting, law, operation, investment and  M&A,  risk  management), professional skills, and industry experience.

In accordance with Chapter 3 of the 'Company's Corporate Governance Practice Principles - Strengthen the functions of the Board of Directors', each board member shall have the necessary knowledge, skill, and experience to perform their duties. In order to achieve the ideal objective of corporate governance, the abilities that must be present in the board as a whole are as follows:

- A. The ability to make judgments about operations.
- B. Accounting and financial analysis ability.
- C. Business management ability.

- D. Crisis management ability.
- E. Knowledge of the industry.
- F. An international market perspective.
- G. Leadership ability.
- H. Decision-making ability.
- I. ESG  (Environmental,  Social,  and  Governance)  sustainability  management capability

The current board members of the Company all have relevant experience in the same industry and management ability. However, in order to ensure the sustainable operation of the Company, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be mainly based on expertise and complementarity in each sector. Future goals include increasing the number of female directors and independent directors.

## (V) Where the Company has any of the following circumstances, the remuneration of Individual Directors shall be disclosed

- 1. Where the Company has posted after-tax deficits in the parent company only financial reports or individual financial reports within the three most recent fiscal years, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to Individual Directors. This requirement, however, shall not apply if the Company has posted net income after tax in the parent company only financial report or individual financial report for the most recent fiscal year and such net income after tax is sufficient to offset the accumulated deficits: None.
- 2. Where the Company has had an insufficient Director shareholding percentage for 3 consecutive months or longer during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration of individual Directors: None.
- 3. Where the Company has had an average ratio of share pledging by Directors in excess of 50 percent in any 3 months during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to each Director having a ratio of pledged shares in excess of 50 percent for each such month: None.
- 4. If the total amount of remuneration received by all of the Directors in their capacity as Directors of all of the companies listed in the financial reports exceeds 2 percent of the net income after tax, and the remuneration received by any individual Director exceeds NT$15 million, the Company shall disclose the remuneration paid to that individual Director or Supervisor: None.
- 5. If the Company is ranked in the lowest or second lowest tier in the corporate governance evaluation for the most recent fiscal year, or in the most recent fiscal year or up to the date of publication of the financial report for that year, the Company's securities have been placed under an altered trading method, suspended from trading, delisted from the TWSE or the TPEx, or the Corporate Governance Evaluation Committee has resolved the Company shall be excluded from the evaluation: None.
- 6. If the average annual salary of the full-time non-supervisory employees in the Company is less than NT$500,000 in the most recent fiscal year: None.
- 7. If the Company had an increase of 10 percent or more in net profit after tax for the most recent fiscal year, but the average annual salary of its full-time non-management employees did not increase relative to the preceding fiscal year: None.
- 8. If the Company had a decline in after-tax net income reaching 10 percent and exceeding NT$5 million for the most recent fiscal year, along with an increase in its average remuneration per director (not including the remuneration of those who are also employees) reaching 10 percent or more and exceeding NT$100,000: None.
- (VI) If the circumstance in item 1 or item 5 applies to the Company, it shall disclose the individual remuneration paid to each of its top five management personnel None.

- 2. Remuneration policies, standards, and packages, the procedure for determining remuneration, and its linkage to operating performance and future risk exposure:
- (1) According to the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, if the Company makes profits for the year, it shall set aside no more than 2% of the pre-tax profits of the current period before the deduction of employee remuneration and Director remuneration as Directors' remuneration, and pay  reasonable  remuneration  to  Directors  taking  into  account  the  operating  results  of  the Company and their contribution to the Company's performance.
- (2) In accordance with the Company's compensation policy, the remuneration paid to managers of the Company shall be based on the salary level of the position in the same industry, the scope of responsibility of such position within the Company and the contribution to their company's operational objectives.
- (3) The Company has established a procedure for remuneration, which takes into account not only the overall operational performance of the Company but also the individual's performance, including the achievement rate of sustainability management performance and the contribution to the company's performance, in order to provide fair compensation. The relevant remuneration shall be submitted to the Remuneration Committee for review and the Board of Directors for resolution. The Company also monitors the changes in the global economy, the international financial environment, ESG corporate sustainable development and the industrial climate at any time to predict the Company's future operation development, profit situation and operation risks, as well as changes in relevant laws and regulations, and reviews the remuneration system on a timely basis to strike a balance between the Company's sustainable operation and risk control.

## (III) Operations of the Sustainability Development Committee

The company established the Sustainability Development Committee in November 2022, consisting of 4  independent  directors.  The  committee  is  responsible  for  supervising  the  formulation  and implementation of the company's sustainability development direction, goals, relevant management policies, and specific implementation plans. It ensures the company's implementation in various aspects of sustainability development, including corporate governance, environment, society, climate change mitigation, and achievement of carbon reduction targets. The committee regularly submits its related achievements to the board of directors.

## ￭ Supplier Relations

Based on our business vision, market trends, international initiatives, and legal regulations, as well as standards or assessments such as RBA, SBTi, TCFD, CDP, AEO, and ISO systems, the company has formulated relevant supplier management guidelines and audit systems. These aim to ensure that suppliers safeguard labor rights, enhance energy efficiency, focus on environmental health and safety, commit to environmental protection, work towards net zero emissions, provide a safe workplace, comply with legal policies, and achieve sustainable business goals.

## ■ Implementation of risk management policies and risk measurement standards

- 1. Risk management policies and procedures

The Company adopts the 'Risk Management Policies and Procedures' as the highest guiding principle of the Company's risk management, the Company reviews its risks from time to time annually, and identifies and assesses risks that the Company may face in advance, and then takes pre-emptive risk control measures in order to discover in advance risk factors that may cause

adverse effects on business operations, and continuously monitors and improves procedures to minimize the likelihood of potential risks occurring and the impact on the Company's operation.

The Company formulated the "Risk Management Procedures" on August 15, 2007. In order to achieve the Company's goals and sustainable operations, it was amended as the "Risk Management Policies and Procedures" approved by the Board of Directors in 2020. The latest version was also updated on December 22, 2023, and passed by the resolution of the 20th Meeting of the 20th Session of Board of Directors.

## 2. Authority and Responsibility

Responsible Unit:

- (1) Perform risk identification
- (2) Perform risk assessment
- (3) Formulate risk handling plans
- (4) Implement risk management plans

Risk Management Committee:

- (1) Approve risk management plans
- (2) Confirm the effectiveness of the implementation of risk handling plans
- (3) Present risk reports

## 3. Risk management scope

The Company takes precautionary measures in advance to reduce the losses caused by risks. The responsible unit addresses the risks that may harm the Company's operation due to the international situation, climate change, the overall economy, legal changes and other factors, such as: strategic risks, financial risks, operational risks, hazard risks that may affect the Company's operation, conducts  risk  management  according  to  the  identifying,  evaluating,  processing,  monitoring procedures, etc. to control the risks arising from the Company's business activities in order to achieve the goals to an acceptable extent, assesses the frequency of risk events and the impact on the Company's operations based on the risk matrix, identifies the risk level and priorities, and formulates the corresponding risk handling plan.

To address the requirements from customers regarding climate change, carbon reduction pathways and use of renewables, the Company has been implementing greenhouse gas accounting and verification and environmental projects such as TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures), CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) and SBTi (Science Based Targets initiative).

##  Introduce green cycle:

The Company sets "provide a completely green solution, become the best partner of cutting-edge environmental energy" as its business vision, will be "to become the top two power supplier in the  global  power  supply  industry"  as  its  development  goal.  In  addition  to  designing  and manufacturing stable, high-quality, safe and green power products, the Company will develop towards upstream of the supply chain in the future to create an innovative energy aggregation service business model: electricity generation, power transfer, electricity consumption, electricity storage, aggregation service, etc. By leveraging its power supply technology, the Company has been developing automobile power control systems from starting, charging, shunting, to DCDC conversion for both electric two-wheelers and electric four-wheelers, as well as devoting in the research and development and sales of green power.  This diversification aims to boost the Company's total revenues.

The Company will introduce the green cycle (green design → green procurement → green manufacturing  process → green  packaging → green  transportation)  fully  into  the  product manufacturing process, produce environmental protection and energy-saving product with the improvement of its own research and development technology, to meet the needs and expectations of customers and consumers for power products with a comprehensive quality approach.

##  Customer satisfaction survey:

Customer satisfaction is the core value of the Company, and we attach importance to the views and opinions of customers. Department of dedicated business, customer service and quality assurance  carry  out  customer  satisfaction  surveys  through  monthly  or  quarterly  customer management meetings and the semi-annual rating on product quality, service quality, delivery quality, price quality, technical capability and overall satisfaction, to understand their recognition or criticism on the Company as a reference for improvement in a timely manner. Its statistical comprehensive survey results have been highly recognized by customers for consecutive years.

## ■ Intellectual Property Management:

In order to establish the competitive advantage of products, enhance the brand image, improve the corporate profits, and avoid the loss caused by infringement, the Company's dedicated department has developed an intellectual property management system aligned with business objectives. The purpose is to connects R&D resources with business expansion needs and to ensure the Company's profitability.

-  Patent-related management and protection measures:

The Company has established a reward system for the patent application, encourages R&D personnel to make creative proposals, and assists and tracks patent output for key R&D projects under the product roadmap for the future. Before each application is submitted, the Company carries out the patent literature retrieval process first to understand the prior technical status, strengthens the technical content and discussion of its own patent application. The Company has set up a patent application review committee to receive suggestions by grading, evaluation and discussion, so as to strengthen the quality of the application proposal again.

The  Company  establishes  the  patent  roadmap,  collects,  monitors  and  analyzes  the  patent application status of other companies in the same industry, classifies the patent roadmap according to the technical content and technical feature, so as to establish a technical matrix roadmap, and identify the part without legal risk as the design reference manual for the R&D personnel, and strengthen the research and development energy. For the right of patent announcement suspected of infringement, the Company will conduct previous case retrieval and review history analysis, build profiles and control, and discuss with the R&D personnel, so as to avoid infringement at the design stage and prevent the Company from suffering losses.

##  Trade secret management and protection measures:

The Company stipulates the confidentiality obligation of company secrets, prohibited disclosure or use of the trade secrets owned by the former employer and other provisions in the employee employment contract. The Company files confidential technical documents in the document control center and manages the rights to download, copy and access documents, which is traceable. Access control is set up in important areas. The non-disclosure agreement (NDA) is required to be signed by all the relevant manufacturers.

-  Trademark management and protection measures:

The Company regularly reviews the market expansion plan with relevant personnel, and actively engages in the operation and product sales of nationally registered company trademark.

-  Copyright management and protection measures:

The Company stores important technical related works such as circuit diagram and organization diagram in the document control center or R&D center, with the implementation of access control and flow tracking, and encrypts internal computer files with the implementation of access control and flow tracking.

Please  refer  to  the  Company's  website/Investors  Section/Corporate  Governance  Section (http://www.acbel.com)  for  information  on  the  implementation  of  intellectual  property management of the Company.

##  Low carbon sustainable management:

In order to implement carbon risk management in response to climate change, the Company actively participates in the Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), filling out questionnaires covering climate change and water security issues, so as to assess the risks and opportunities of the Company in the face of climate change and develop appropriate countermeasures. In 2024, our company achieved an A- leadership level in both the Climate Change and Water Security questionnaires of the CDP Carbon Disclosure Project.

Since the end of 2019, the Company has introduced the TCFD climate-related financial disclosure governance framework, integrates climate change risk identification and opportunity assessment into the corporate governance and management mechanism, progressively evaluates mediumterm and long-term physical risks, transformation risks and business opportunities based on appropriate climate change scenarios, reflects the evaluation results to business strategy, business model  and  financial  planning,  sets  up  or  adjusts  management  policy  and  key  indicators accordingly. On the other hand, the Company considers the needs of stakeholders, effectively communicates the positive and negative impacts of climate change on the Company's substantive financial,  and  shows  the  Company's  integrated  governance  performance.  In  addition,  the Company identifies the key risks of the supply chain one by one, sets up scenarios to quantify the potential financial impact of the related risks, drafts the corresponding mitigation and adjustment measures as early as possible, and formulates the optimal sustainable supply chain portfolio according to different risk scenarios.

From 2020, we followed the TCFD structure in the disclosure of governance, strategy, risk management, indicators and targets in relation to climate related risks and opportunities. The aforesaid information is available on our company's website and sustainability reports (URL: http://www.acbel.com).

We came up with our commitment to the Science-Based Target Initiatives (SBTi) approach, i.e., medium-term and long-term carbon reduction goals for carbon reduction. In 2023, our company underwent a compliance review by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and successfully passed. We have systematized the tracking and management of carbon reduction achievements to fulfill our commitment to low-carbon sustainability.

At AcBel Polytech, we regard the harmonious coexistence of humans and the natural environment as the cornerstone of sustainable corporate development. By adhering to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and the Convention on Biological Diversity, we focus on the integrity of aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems. In our operational activities, we adhere to the following guidelines:

- A. Comply with environmental protection laws and regulations in the operating location, including but not limited to greenhouse gas inventory, water footprint assessment, waste declaration, and exhaust gas testing, to reduce negative impacts on the environment and biodiversity.

- C. Adopt eco-friendly architectural designs for new factory construction. When modifying existing factory premises, adhere to local building regulations concerning eco-friendly conditions to minimize impacts on biodiversity.
- D. Implement circular economy principles in product design or increase the procurement and use of recycled materials to reduce environmental impacts caused by raw material extraction and transportation.
- E. Implement continuous improvement projects in product manufacturing, such as process optimization,  use  of  renewable  energy,  energy-saving  initiatives,  etc.,  to  enhance operational efficiency and reduce natural resource consumption.
- F. Establish renewable energy facilities in accordance with local environmental regulations to minimize  environmental  impacts  on  the  site  and  surrounding  areas.  When  procuring renewable energy, prioritize products with minimal environmental impact.
- G. Support  appropriate  biodiversity  conservation  projects,  focus  on  ecological  indicator monitoring and maintenance, and disclose relevant progress and benefits.
- H. Focus on the company's reliance on and impact on the natural environment in operations, regularly identify risk management and opportunities, formulate corresponding strategies, indicators, and goals, and publicly disclose relevant progress and achievements.
- I. Organize and promote environmental education activities related to biodiversity to raise awareness of biodiversity among oneself and value chain partners.

## (XI) Implementation of the Internal Control System

- 1. Internal Control Statement

## AcBel Polytech Inc. Statement on Internal Control System

Date: March 12, 2024

According to the self-evaluation results of the internal control system by the Company in 2023, we hereby state as follows:

- I. The  Company's  Board  of  Directors  and  management  are  responsible  for  establishing, implementing, and maintaining an adequate internal control system, and such a system has been established. The purpose of establishing the internal control system is to reasonably assure the following objectives: The effectiveness and efficiency of business operation (including earnings, operation  performance  and  the  safeguard  of  company  assets);  the  reliability,  timeliness, transparency of report; and Achieve compliance objectives according to the relevant laws and regulations in order to provide reasonable assurances.
- II. Due to the innate limitation in designing a faultless internal control system, this system can only assure the reasonableness of the above three objectives has been fairly achieved. In addition, the effectiveness of the internal control system could alter over time due to the change of business environment or situation. Since the Company's internal control system is provided with a selfmonitoring mechanism, the Company will take corrective actions in response to any identified deficiencies.
- III. The evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control system design and implementation is made in accordance with the Guidelines for the Establishment of Internal Control Systems by Public Companies (the Guidelines). The Guidelines are made to examine the following five factors during the management and control process: (1) control environment, (2) risk assessment and response, (3) control activities, (4) information and communication, and (5) supervision. Each factor also includes several items. Please refer to the Guidelines for the preceding items.
- IV. The Company has examined the effectiveness of each respected area in the internal control system based on the Guidelines.
- V. Based on the findings of such evaluation, the Company believes that, on December 31, 2023, it has maintained, in all material respects, an effective internal control system (including the supervision and management of our subsidiaries), to provide reasonable assurance over our operational effectiveness and efficiency, reliability, timeliness, transparency of reporting, and compliance with applicable laws, regulations and bylaws.
- VI. This Statement is a significant part of the Company's annual report and prospectus available to the general public. If any of the disclosed contents above contains false information or omits any material content, the Company will involve legal liability under Article 20, Article 32, Article 171 and Article 174 set forth in the Security and Exchange Act.
- VII. The Company hereby declares that this statement had been adopted by the Board of Directors on March 12, 2024. Among the 12 attending Directors, 0 Director raised any objection and all consented to the content expressed in this Statement.

## (VI) Company's dividend policy and implementation thereof

- 1. Dividend policy adopted in the Company's Articles of Incorporation
- In accordance with Article 26-1 of the Articles of Incorporation, if there are any earnings after the Company's annual closing of the books, the Company shall first pay all taxes and dues and cover accumulated losses, then appropriate 10% of the earnings as the statutory surplus reserve; provided that this restriction shall not apply if the statutory surplus reserve has reached the paid-in capital of the Company. The Company shall make provision or reversal for special surplus reserve from the remaining earnings as required by law or by the provisions of competent authorities. If there is still a balance, the Board of Directors shall draw up an earnings distribution plan for the balance and the undistributed retained earnings at the beginning of the period, and submit it to the board of shareholders for a resolution on distribution.

The Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses, capital reserves or statutory surplus reserves payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.

The Company is at a stage of steady growth. In consideration of the Company's future capital needs and to meet the needs of shareholders for cash inflows, the annual cash dividend paid shall not be less than 50% of the total cash and stock dividends paid in the current year if there are earnings available for distribution after the Company's annual closing of the books.

- 2. Dividend distributions proposed at the Shareholders' Meeting
- In accordance with the Articles of Incorporation, the Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors,
- and report to the shareholders' meeting.
- The Company's cash dividends distributed from earnings in 2023 have been passed by the Board of Directors  on  March  12,  2024.  The  shareholder  dividends  distributed  from  earnings  in  2024  is NT$430,930,063, which was paid in cash in NT$0.5 per share.
- The Board of Directors shall authorize the chairman to handle the current cash dividend distributed from earnings discretionarily if the number of outstanding shares is subsequently affected by the Company's repurchase or recovery of its own shares, cancellation of the share capital or other factors, resulting in changes in the shareholders' allocation ratio which need to be corrected.
- 3. An explanation for any expected material changes in the dividend policy: None.

## (VIII) Remuneration to employees and directors

- 1. The percentages or ranges with respect to the remuneration of the employee and Directors, as set forth in the Company's Articles of Incorporation:
- In accordance with Article 26 of the Articles of Incorporation, if the Company has gained profits within a fiscal year, at least 2% of the profits shall be allocated as the employees' remuneration and less than 2% as the Directors' remuneration. However, in case of the accumulated losses, certain profits shall first be reserved to cover them.
- The term "profits gained within a fiscal year" as mentioned in the preceding paragraph refers to the pre-tax profit of the current year less the profit before the distribution of remuneration to employees and Directors.
- Employee remuneration may be paid in the form of shares or in cash to employees covering the employees of subsidiaries reinvested by the Company with shareholding of more than 50%.
- 2. The basis for estimating the amount of employees' and Directors' remuneration, for calculating the number of shares to be distributed as employee remuneration, and the accounting treatment of the discrepancy, if any, between the actual distributed amount and the estimated figure, for the current period: The basis for estimating the amount of employees and Directors remuneration shall be the pre-tax profit of the current year less the profit before the remuneration of employee and Directors multiplied by the distribution ratio of remuneration to employees and Directors as stipulated in the Articles of Incorporation of the Company (at least 2% of the profits shall be allocated as the employees' remuneration, and less than 2% as the Director's remuneration). Where the employees' remuneration is paid in the form of shares, it shall be calculated on the basis of the closing price of ordinary shares on the day preceding the board resolution. If there is any discrepancy between the actual distributed amount and the estimated figure, the discrepancy shall be treated as the change in accounting estimate and recognized as the profit and
- loss of the following year.
- 3. Information on any approval by the Board of Directors of distribution of remuneration:

## (II) Industrial Overview:

- 1. The Current Status and Development of the Industry
- (1) Power Supply Industry

Power Supply is a device that supplies stable and appropriate voltage or current to electronic products. Depending on the function and basic structure of the product, it is widely used in two major markets: consumer market and enterprise market.

- A.  The consumer market, which mainly covers PCs and consumer electronic devices, is currently facing a tough environment with low price competition from manufacturers of the related industry.    In view of the development of AI applications and the gaming market, it was originally estimated in 2024 that the potential replacement of PCs and the demand for high-specification power supplies would drive demand in the consumer market. However, the  rising  operating  costs  of  AI  applications  have  revised  the  original  optimism  to conservatism, and the growth explosion may be delayed until next year or the year after.
- B. Enterprise  cloud  power  supplies  are  mainly  applied  to  servers,  storage  devices,  and networking products. Although in 2023, due to interest rate hikes and economic recession concerns, cloud customers have become more conservative in their capital expenditures, canceling or suspending data center expansion plans one after another and extending the service life of their equipment. However, according to Digitimes' forecast, the AI cloud trend will lead the four major cloud providers in North America to return to a high-speed growth trajectory in capital expenditure in 2024, and it is estimated that the penetration rate of the four major providers will account for more than half of the overall server market in 2026. With the changing needs of data center design, there will be a move toward higher power, high density, high conversion efficiency, liquid cooling and other technologies.
- C. At this stage, the smart grid market is still dominated by the deployment of infrastructure (smart meters). Due to the increase in the proportion of decentralized power generation from renewable energy and energy storage systems, it is expected that this will put pressure on the existing power system. The digitization and intelligence of the power grid will help to dynamically balance the power system between traditional units and renewable energy sources, which is an important key to the future energy transformation.

## (2) Solar farm industry

The  net-zero  carbon-emission  transition  policies  of  various  countries  have  prompted  the transformation of industries and at the same time driven the development of the green energy

industry. Taiwan's government is promoting the '2050 Net Zero Carbon Emission Pathway', with a budget of nearly NT$900 billion by 2030, which will drive more than 4 trillion dollars of private investment. According to the report released by PwC Taiwan, 9.5% of Taiwan's total electricity generation of 282.1 billion kWh in 2023 will come from renewable energy sources, with solar energy accounting for 48% of the total renewable energy generation, amounting to 12.9 billion kWh, an increase of 20% over the previous year.

## (3) Electric Vehicle Industry

With the rapid development of battery and automotive technology, the automotive industry is moving from fuel vehicles to electrification. Depending on the type of power supply and its proportion, they can be categorized into battery electric vehicles (BEVs), hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs), PHEVs (plug-in hybrid electric vehicles), and range extender electric vehicles (REEVs). According to IEK Consulting of Industrial Technology Research Institute, the global automobile market has resumed growth after the epidemic, and with the trend of net-zero emissions, the global sales volume of EVs will exceed 20 million units in 2023, with an annual growth rate of nearly 30%, and is expected to exceed 30 million units in 2025, with the penetration rate of EVs reaching 32%, and the compounded growth rate of EVs reaching 22% per annum. In addition, the rapid growth of EVs is also driving the demand for charging piles. According to TrendForce, the total number of public charging piles in the world is expected to reach 16 million in 2026, which is about triple the number in 2023. In conjunction with the Net Zero Act in Europe and the Biden Administration's construction goals in the U.S., the development of the charging pile market will have the opportunity to advance even further.

- 2. The Links between the Upstream, Midstream, and Downstream Segments of the Industry Supply Chain

## Links between upstream raw materials and the industry

The  main  raw  materials  for  switching  power  supplies  can  be  broadly  categorized  into  active components, passive components, magnetic components, other electronic components, chassis and printed circuit boards. Active components are mainly imported, while passive components and magnetic materials have a high domestic production rate. As the importance of power management functions increases, micro controllers or DSP chips will become the key components of high-end power  supplies.  Through  cooperation  and  information  exchange  with  upstream  suppliers,  the Company adjusts its supply chain and product development strategy to meet customer needs.

## Links between downstream application products and switching power supplies

Domestically  produced  switching  power  supplies  are  mainly  used  in  communication  products, computers and their peripherals, and in recent years, with the rapid development and popularization of AI technology, power supplies have become an important key component for AI applications. For high-performance AI servers, power supplies have to provide sufficient and stable power to drive CPUs, GPUs, or AI accelerators, and the efficiency of the power supply product is extremely critical, mainly because it directly affects the overall energy consumption and heat dissipation requirements. Highly efficient power supplies can also extend the lifespan of power supply and reduce server downtime due to power issues.

## 3. Trends of Products

Technology development is rapidly moving in the direction of high efficiency, multiple input voltages, wide operating temperatures, and intelligence, expanding the scope of applications from traditional data center equipment to communication machine rooms and base stations. In the consumer sector, the focus is on lightweight, thin, short, and small products, and AI PCs with high-performance GPUs and gamingtype PC power supply technologies are also expanding. In the enterprise cloud and communications sector, the construction of large-scale data centers is driving the trend of modular cabinet design, and the introduction of new energy sources is driving the demand for more efficient high-voltage DC systems, while communications power supplies are adopting a decentralized architecture and focusing on product reliability. The rise of different architectures and applications is expected to create new growth momentum in the highly standardized communications power supply market.

In the field of electric vehicles, from the initial individual components (such as on-board chargers, motor controllers, and DC converters), we are gradually moving towards integrated design (all-in-one electronic control products). The integrated design enables the mechanism and appearance to be shared to achieve universal miniaturized design and increase power density, and to develop to higher voltage systems (e.g. 800V), all-in-one integrated products, and new generation of compound semiconductor applications.

## 4. Competition

The power supply industry is an industry with a high rate of self-manufacturing and driven by the demand for downstream information products. With the rise of concepts such as energy saving, carbon reduction, smart power usage and cloud services, the conversion efficiency, power management

functions and power planning of power supplies have become the focus of competition.

Over the past few years, the global power supply industry has gone through consolidation and elimination toward the trend of consolidation, but there is still no single competitor can dominate the market, mainly by the large Taiwan-based manufacturers to compete with each other, in addition, the positioning of the products of various manufacturers, coupled with the different manufacturing, R&D capabilities in different areas and applications have room for their growth and development.

## Advantages

-  Global energy prices trend up and environmental awareness is rising. The demand for highefficiency and high-density energy-saving solutions is the future development trend.
-  We have a multinational R&D center and customer service, which can meet the needs of customer orders at any time, and cooperate with the process characteristics and capacity planning of the production base.
-  The Company has established and passed the certification of a rigorous quality management system. Its products are in line with a number of international certifications, and the Company strives for quality recognized by all cooperative customers.
-  Standardized and modular design is adopted to shorten the product design cycle, increase product diversity and mix, and unify materials to save production costs.
-  Continue to introduce automation equipment in the production process to ensure product quality, reduce the number of workers and reduce production costs.
-  The corporate image of Kinpo Group which the Company owned by is healthy, which is conducive to obtain new high-quality solar power generation projects.
-  The government's budget investment in smart grid infrastructure is gradually expanding. At present, hundreds of thousands of smart grid infrastructure have been shipped by the Company, which is beneficial for its subsequent bidding and accumulation of its manufacturing experience.
-  The government expects to achieve the goal of non-nuclear home by 2025, with renewables accounting for 20% of power generation. The Company actively builds solar power stations, which is in line with the electricity generation strategy.

## Negative Factors

-  Consumer  electronic  products  have  a  short  life  cycle.  The  Company  assists  customers  in developing new products to shorten the lead time.
-  Power supply standard items are gradually matured; manufacturers in Taiwan and abroad are mostly focused on personal computers (DT/NB/AOI) and hand-held devices (mobile phones /tablets), causing fierce price competitions.
-  Popularity of electric vehicles has changed the quantities demanded for some key parts and components, which further impacts IC and Mosfet demands, creating extension of supply chain delivery time.
-  The rise of the red supply chain and the Chinese government's support for mainland-based manufacturers has resulted in intensive price competition.
-  Uncertain factors such as climate and sunshine affect the stability of solar power plant efficiency.
-  COVID-19 pandemic, Russia-Ukraine War, and demand pressure have impacted supply chain and consequently increased difficulty to meet client needs.
-  5G products and electric vehicles products show optimistic demands; pressured semiconductor productivity has impacted IC product supply end.
-  ESG is the international future trend.    Major countries around the world are also planning to achieve net zero carbon emission by 2050.    Following the advancement of ESG, demands from clients have been strengthening.    Many products will be eliminated, especially that there will be great amounts of costs spent on carbon taxes in the future.    Products' carbon emission amounts

will be the key determining factor for success for future orders.

## Response Strategies

-  Implement  precise  manufacturing  and  strive  for  balance  among  production,  supply  and marketing, so as to effectively improve operating efficiency and reduce costs.
-  Strengthen the innovative and entrepreneurial spirit of the organization and colleagues, and make good  use  of  the  technology  and  knowledge  management  of  the  power  industry,  so  as  to successfully develop new business opportunities in solar power generation fields.
-  Develop an intelligent energy management system platform, especially solar power generation site  management,  which  can  monitor  and  further  optimize  the  management  of  site  power generation efficiency and equipment maintenance, so as to effectively reduce site investment risks and improve the revenue of power generation.
-  Strengthen cooperation with customers, consolidate the loyalty of mainstream customers and their products and expand to other products of customers by virtue of years of cooperation experience.
-  Optimize the product mix to increase profits, develop new customers, develop new products and strengthen R&D energy, and open up new markets with the Company's own R&D capabilities.
-  Continuously  promote  design  standardization,  shorten  the  development  cycle,  expand procurement volume, and thus improve factory automation and quality consistency.
-  Providing clean and highly efficient energy resolution plans and becoming sustainable and positive energy is AcBel's vision.    We are dedicated to actualizing environment sustainability from all aspects, including regulations related to 100% non-hazardous matters, becoming the world's first electronic technology enterprise passing TCFD maturity assessment last November, completions  of  CDP  (Carbon  Disclosure  Project)  climate  change  and  water  security questionnaires, and completions of ISO 14064:2018 greenhouse gas Scope 3 and ISO 14046 organizational water footprint inventory in all manufacturing plants.

The Division is set up to assist in various cybersecurity projects and international cybersecurity certifications. Currently, both the cybersecurity manager and the cybersecurity personnel are in place.

The Global Cyber Security Division is responsible for reviewing the Company's cyber security management policies, monitoring cyber security management operational status, and promoting the establishment of cyber security related special projects and daily maintenance management.    Each year, the Division would report routinely to the Board of Directors on cyber security governance performance and execution status.

## Cyber security strategy:

The cyber security strategy of the Company and its subsidiaries is based on the NIST Cybersecurity Framework in industrial automation and control systems, in order to design and deploy a highly secure, highly reliable and trustworthy network structure and information service system. The purpose is to continue shipments that meet customers' needs and comply with relevant laws and regulations, to maximize the value of corporate information.

## Cyber security management:

To  effectively  prevent  sensitive  data  from  theft,  tampering,  loss  or  missing  and  to  protect  the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the information system, information departments assist individual departments in relevant cyber security control measures:

- ￭ Continuous Optimization of Cyber Security Process
- ． Planning data storage method and document user's guide.
- ． Continuous examination of operational plans and off-site data backup.
- ． Assistance with cyber security assessment and execution of improvement process.
- ￭ Proactive Reinforcement of Cyber Security Infrastructure
- ． Establishment  of  data  leakage  prevention  system  and  sensitive  document  protection mechanism.
- ． Establishment of next-generation firewall protection system with multi-layered subdivisions.
- ． Establishment  of  real-time  intrusion  detection  system  and  multifunctional  endpoint protection system.
- ． Establishment of operational system weakness management system and assistance with applied system penetration test
- ￭ Routine Enhancement of Colleagues' Cyber Security Mindset
- ． Signing of cyber security statements by all colleagues each year
- ． Cyber  security  stimulations  and  drills  each  year  and  enhancement  of  cyber  security awareness
- ． Monthly information e-newspapers to provide info on cyber security
- ． Advocacy and supervision of the compliance by colleagues with the Company's cyber security policies
- ． Assistance with conducting newcomers' online cyber security educational trainings.
- ． Conducting physical or online educational trainings with cyber security related topics.

Note 2:  The calculation formulas for the above items of financial analysis data are listed as follows:

- 1. Financial structure
- (1) Debt-to-assets ratio = Total liabilities / Total assets.
- (2) Ratio of long-term capital to property, plant and equipment = (Total equity + Non-current liabilities) / Net property, plant and equipment.
- 2. Solvency
- (1) Current ratio = Current assets / Current liabilities.
- (2) Quick ratio = (Current assets - Inventory - Prepaid expenses) / Current liabilities.
- (3) Interest coverage ratio = Income before tax and interest expenses / Interest expenses.
- 3. Operating Ability
- (1) Receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Net sales / Balance of average receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations).
- (2) Average collection days = 365 / Receivables turnover ratio.
- (3) Inventory turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Average inventory.
- (4) Payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Balance of average payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations).
- (5) Average days for sale = 365 / Inventory turnover ratio.

- (6) Property, plant and equipment turnover ratio = Net sales / Average net property, plant and equipment.
- (7) Total asset turnover ratio = Net sales / Average total assets.
- 4. Profitability
- (1) Return on assets = [Net income after tax + Interest expenses x (1 - Tax rate)] / Average total assets.
- (2) Return on equity = Net income after tax / Average total equity.
- (3) Net profit margin = Net income after tax / Net sales.
- (4) Earnings per share = (Net income attributable to owners of parent company - Dividends on preferred shares) / Weighted average number of shares issued (Note 4).

## 5. Cash Flow

- (1) Cash flow ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities / Current liabilities.
- (2) Net cash flow adequacy ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities for the most recent five years / (Capital expenditures + Inventory increase + Cash dividends) for the most recent five years.
- (3) Cash reinvestment ratio = (Net cash flow from operating activities - Cash dividends) / (Gross property, plant and equipment + Long-term investments + Other non-current assets + Working capital). (Note 5)

## 6. Leverage

- (1) Operating leverage = (Net operating income - Changes in operating costs and expenses)/Operating income (Note 6).
- (2) Financial leverage = Operating income / (Operating income - Interest expenses).
- Note 4: Special attention shall be paid to the following matters when the above calculation formula for earnings per share is used:
- 1. Use the weighted average number of ordinary shares, not the number of shares issued at the end of the year.
- 2. Capital increase for cash or treasury shares transactions shall be considered when the weighted average number of shares is calculated.
- 3. Capital increase from surplus earnings or capital reserve shall be retrospectively adjusted by the proportion of capital increase when earnings per share for previous annual and semi-annual periods are calculated. The issue period for capital increase does not have to be considered.
- 4. For preferred shares that are non-convertible accumulated preferred shares, dividends (regardless of whether they are distributed) shall be deducted from net income after tax or included as net loss after tax. If preferred shares are non-cumulative, where net income after tax is available, dividends on preferred shares shall be deducted from net income after tax. No adjustment is required if the Company has loss after tax.

## Note 5: Special attention shall be paid to the following in the process of cash flow analysis:

- 1. Net cash flow from operating activities refers to net cash flow generated from operating activities in the statement of cash flows.
- 2. Capital expenditures refer to the annual cash flow used in capital investment.
- 3. The increase in inventory is included only if the balance at the end of the year is greater than the balance at the beginning of the year. If it is the other way around, the number used should be zero.
- 4. Cash dividends include cash dividends on ordinary shares and preferred shares.
- 5. Gross  property,  plant  and  equipment  refers  to  the  total  value  of  property,  plant  and  equipment  minus accumulated depreciation.
- Note 6: The issuer shall classify the operating costs and operating expenses as fixed or variable based on their nature. If it involves estimation or subjective judgment, attention shall be paid to its rationality and consistency.
- Note 7: Where company shares have no par value or where the par value per share is not NT$10, any calculation involving paid-in capital and its ratio shall be replaced with the calculation of the ratio of equity attributable to owners of the parent company in the balance sheet.

Note 3:

- The calculation formulas for the above items of financial analysis data are listed as follows:
- 1. Financial structure
- (1) Debt-to-assets ratio = Total liabilities / Total assets.
- (2) Ratio of long-term capital to property, plant and equipment = (Total equity + Non-current liabilities) / Net property, plant and equipment.
- 2. Solvency
- (1) Current ratio = Current assets / Current liabilities.
- (2) Quick ratio = (Current assets - Inventory - Prepaid expenses) / Current liabilities.
- (3) Interest coverage ratio = Income before tax and interest expenses / Interest expenses.
- 3. Operating Ability
- (1) Receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Net sales / Balance of average receivables (including accounts receivable and notes receivable due to business operations).
- (2) Average collection days = 365 / Receivables turnover ratio.
- (3) Inventory turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Average inventory.
- (4) Payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations) turnover ratio = Cost of goods sold / Balance of average payables (including accounts payable and notes payable due to business operations).
- (5) Average days for sale = 365 / Inventory turnover ratio.

- (6) Property, plant and equipment turnover ratio = Net sales / Average net property, plant and equipment.
- (7) Total asset turnover ratio = Net sales / Average total assets.

## 4. Profitability

- (1) Return on assets = [Net income after tax + Interest expenses x (1 - Tax rate)] / Average total assets.
- (2) Return on equity = Net income after tax / Average total equity.
- (3) Net profit margin = Net income after tax / Net sales.
- (4) Earnings per share = (Net income attributable to owners of parent company - Dividends on preferred shares) / Weighted average number of shares issued (Note 4).

## 5. Cash Flow

- (1) Cash flow ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities / Current liabilities.
- (2) Net cash flow adequacy ratio = Net cash flow from operating activities for the most recent five years / (Capital expenditures + Inventory increase + Cash dividends) for the most recent five years.
- (3) Cash reinvestment ratio = (Net cash flow from operating activities - Cash dividends) / (Gross property, plant and equipment + Long-term investments + Other non-current assets + Working capital). (Note 5)

## 6. Leverage

- (1) Operating leverage = (Net operating income - Changes in operating costs and expenses)/Operating income (Note 6).
- (2) Financial leverage = Operating income / (Operating income - Interest expenses).
- Note 4:  Special attention shall be paid to the following matters when the above calculation formula for earnings per share is
- used:
- 1. Use the weighted average number of ordinary shares, not the number of shares issued at the end of the year.
- 2. Capital increase for cash or treasury shares transactions shall be considered when the weighted average number of shares is calculated.
- 3. Capital increase from surplus earnings or capital reserve shall be retrospectively adjusted by the proportion of capital increase when earnings per share for previous annual and semi-annual periods are calculated. The issue period for capital increase does not have to be considered.
- 4. For preferred shares that are non-convertible accumulated preferred shares, dividends (regardless of whether they are distributed) shall be deducted from net income after tax or included as net loss after tax. If preferred shares are non-cumulative, where net income after tax is available, dividends on preferred shares shall be deducted from net income after tax. No adjustment is required if the Company has loss after tax.

## Note 5:  Special attention shall be paid to the following in the process of cash flow analysis:

- 1. Net cash flow from operating activities refers to net cash flow generated from operating activities in the statement of cash flows.
- 2. Capital expenditures refer to the annual cash flow used in capital investment.
- 3. The increase in inventory is included only if the balance at the end of the year is greater than the balance at the beginning of the year. If it is the other way around, the number used should be zero.
- 4. Cash dividends include cash dividends on ordinary shares and preferred shares.
- 5. Gross  property,  plant  and  equipment  refers  to  the  total  value  of  property,  plant  and  equipment  minus accumulated depreciation.
- Note 6:  The issuer shall classify the operating costs and operating expenses as fixed or variable based on their nature. If it involves estimation or subjective judgment, attention shall be paid to its rationality and consistency.
- Note 7:  Where company shares have no par value or where the par value per share is not NT$10, any calculation involving paid-in capital and its ratio shall be replaced with the calculation of the ratio of equity attributable to owners of the parent company in the balance sheet.

## V. Reinvestment Policy for the Most Recent Fiscal Year, Main Reasons for Profits/Losses Generated Thereby, the Plan for Improving Re-investment Profitability, and Investment Plans for the Coming Year

## (I) Investment Policies

- 1. The Company's long-term investment policy is to increase the core competitiveness, meet customer needs and grasp the future product development of the market, and actively engages in new business areas to pursue breakthrough growth.
- 2. Operate through joint ventures and merger and acquisition, actively look for new opportunities, new technologies and new markets to meet customers' One Stop Shopping, so as to expand the business field.
- 3. The Company actively operates the solar power generation plant, promotes the solar energy system development through a joint venture or the establishment of a new company, and owns the  power  plant,  develops  the  inverter  and  other  plan,  and  grasps  the  key  development technology.
- 4. Reinvest in energy sectors, such as energy management, smart grid, energy storage and electric vehicles, and build core technologies through partnerships with partners or investments in related industries.
- 5. The reinvestment strategy is expected to integrate global production, supply, marketing and research resources, and facilitate the layout and development of the power supply industry and achieve the comprehensive effect of new energy (solar energy, etc.).

## (II) Main Reasons for the Profits/Losses Generated thereby, the Plan for Improving Re-investment Profitability

In recent years, the Company carries out reinvestment actively based on its long-term strategy to seek strategic targets. The Company will continue to provide guidance and support for the affairs required by subsidiaries.

## 2. Changes in Interest Rates

In 2023, the COVID-19 pandemic slowed down, the war between Russia and Ukraine affected the global political and economic situation, accompanied with the increasingly serous inflation problem, U.S. and Europe successively took on tightening interest policies. Central Bank of Taiwan also raised interest rates to tackle inflation. However, there was not much room for interest rates to continue to be adjusted upward, and as the Company and its subsidiaries currently still have a large amount of available bank credits, the impact on the Company's capital utilization should be limited.

## 3. Changes in Exchange Rate

The exchange rate of Taiwan dollar against the US dollar at the end of 2023 was 30.735 dollars, a depreciation of 0.027 dollars (-0.09%) compared with that at the end of 2022, which was favorable to most of the products quoted in US dollars by the Company and its subsidiaries. In order to effectively manage the exchange rate risk, the Company and its subsidiaries try their best to quote in US dollars for purchase and payment, so as to achieve the effect of natural hedging. The Company also has formulated the Operational procedures for Acquisition and Disposal of Assets, with the financial department referring to the analysis of well-known banks and research institutions at home and abroad, to engage in forwarding exchange, exchange rate swaps and other hedging derivative financial commodity trading, so as to reduce the risk of exchange rate fluctuations.

## 4. Inflation

In 2023, the consumer price index (CPI) in Taiwan increased by 2.49% and the producer price index (PPI) in Taiwan decreased by 0.57%, compared with those of 2022. The Company and its subsidiaries adjusted selling prices accordingly and hence the profits and losses were not materially affected.

Power  supply  is  changed  toward  miniaturization,  high  density,  high  efficiency,  low  energy consumption, etc. As the industry changes rapidly, the Company always pays attention to adjust the direction of product development, and according to the current market situation of the products and the accumulation of key technologies. ## (VII) Expected  Benefits  and  Possible  Risks  Associated  with  Any  Mergers  and Acquisitions, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

The Company announced on January 20, 2023 that it would acquire the Power Conversion Division of industrial automation giant ABB (now OmniOn Power). The transaction was completed on July 3,  2023,  officially  integrating  it  into  the  AcBel  Group.  This  acquisition  injects  new  growth momentum into the Company's future revenue streams. In addition to gaining market share in the US communication power sector, the proportion of the group's consumer products is expected to significantly decrease, which is anticipated to benefit both gross profit margin and profitability. Subsequently,  both  parties  have  initiated  strategic  collaborations  in  procurement,  business operations, research and development, and manufacturing. Besides the original business, synergies from the merger are expected. In the future, any merger plans will be carefully assessed, considering the synergies of the merger to ensure the interests of shareholders.

## (VIII) Expected Benefits and Possible Risks Associated with Any Plant Expansion, and Measures to Be Taken in Response

The Company currently has set up seven plants in the whole world, with the daily operation on track. All plants will regularly communicate information with headquarters and other plants to adjust the plant layout in line with the global supply chain adjustment, and make careful evaluation during the transfer process.

The raw materials purchased by the Company are based on the principle of simultaneous supply from multiple suppliers. ## Independent Auditors' Report

To the Board of Directors of AcBel Polytech Inc.:

## Opinion

We have audited the consolidated financial statements of AcBel Polytech Inc. and its subsidiaries ('the Group'), which comprise the consolidated balance sheet as of December 31, 2023 and 2022, the consolidated statement of  comprehensive  income,  changes  in  equity  and  cash  flows  for  the  years  then  ended,  and  notes  to  the consolidated financial statements, including a summary of material accounting policies.

In our opinion, the accompanying consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated  financial position of the Group as of December 31, 2023 and 2022, and its consolidated financial performance  and  its  consolidated  cash  flows  for  the  years  then  ended  in  accordance  with  the  Regulations Governing  the  Preparation  of  Financial  Reports  by  Securities  Issuers  and  with  the  International  Financial Reporting Standards ('IFRSs'), International Accounting Standards ('IASs'), Interpretation developed by the International  Financial  Reporting  Interpretations  Committee(' IFRIC' )  or  the  former  Standing  Interpretations Committee ('SIC') endorsed and issued into effect by the Financial Supervisory Commission of the Republic of China.

## Basis for Opinion

We  conducted  our  audits  in  accordance  with  the  Regulations  Governing  Financial  Statement  Audit  and Attestation Engagements of Certified Public Accountants and Standards on Auditing of the Republic of China. Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the Auditors' Responsibilities for the Audit of the Consolidated Financial Statements section of our report. We are independent of the Group in accordance with The Norm of Professional Ethics for Certified Public Accountant of the Republic of China, and we have fulfilled  our  other  ethical  responsibilities  in  accordance  with  these  requirements.  We believe  that  the  audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis of our opinion.

## Key Audit Matters

Key audit matters are those matters that, in our professional judgment, were of most significance in our audit of the consolidated financial statements of the current period. These matters were addressed in the context of our audit of the consolidated financial statements as a whole, and in forming our opinion thereon, and we do not provide a separate opinion on these matters. The key audit matters we judged shall be presented in the auditors' report were as follows:

## 1. Operating Revenue- Revenue Recognition of Vender Management Inventory (VMI)

Please refer to note (4)(o) revenue for operating revenue recognition (including VMI). Information regarding sales  revenue  and  revenue  from  contracts  with  customers  is  shown  in  note  (6)(y)  of  the  consolidated financial statements.

<!-- image -->

## Description of key audit matter:

The Group has established vender managed inventories in overseas warehouses which do not belong to the Group. The revenue recognition, according to the partial sales contract of the Group, should be based on the circumstance  of  VMI client  delivery.  Both  parties  reconcile  periodically  to  ensure  the  consistency  in  the amount and timing of sales recognition. Therefore, revenue recognition, VMI is one of the key judgmental areas for our audit.

## Audit Procedure:

Our  principal  audit  procedures  included:  understanding  and  testing  the  related  controls  surrounding  the aforementioned sales and collection cycle, reconciling the account records between AcBel Polytech Inc. and VMI  client  delivery,  selectively  conducting  external  confirmations  on  VMI,  as  well  as  assessing  the operating  revenue  recognition  (including  VMI)  of  the  Group  to  determine  whether  related  accounting policies are applied appropriately.

## 2. Inventory valuation

Please refer to note (4)(h) inventories and note (5) of the consolidated financial statements for inventories and accounting estimate of inventory valuation, respectively. Information regarding the inventory and related expenses is shown in note (6)(g) of the consolidated financial statements.

## Description of key audit matter:

Due to the impact of product life cycle and industrial competition in electronics industry, the price variability for the inventory of the Group is expected. Therefore, the test of inventory valuation is one of the significant evaluation in audit procedures.

## Audit procedure:

Our principal audit procedure included: understanding and testing related controls of production cycle and assessing the allowance for loss due to price decline, obsolete, and slow moving inventories to determine whether  policies  of  the  Group  and  accounting  policies  are  applied.  In  addition,  in  order  to  verify  the rationality of assessment on allowance to reduce the price of inventory to the market price, we inspected the inventory aging statement, analyzed the change in aging inventory, as well as verified the aging inventory statement and the calculation of lower of cost or net realizable value

## 3. Business combination

Please refer to note (4)(q), business combination, of the consolidated financial statements for the accounting policy  on  business  combination.  Information  regarding  business  combination  is  shown  in  note  (6)(i) acquisition of the subsidiary of the consolidated financial statements.

## Description of key audit matters:

To promote and accelerate the technological upgrading and transformation of the power supply industry and to deepen the development of the North American market, the Company acquired 100% of Lineage Power Holding Inc. (renamed as Omnion Power Inc.),  the power conversion department of ABB Group on July 3, 2023, through its U.S. subsidiary, AcLeap Power (USA) Inc. Due to the subjective nature of evaluation and complexity of the calculation of the consideration to be transferred and the fair value of the underlying assets to be obtained, the business combination transaction is one of the key audit matters in our audit.

<!-- image -->

## Audit procedures:

- (1) Evaluating the external professional's capability, objectivity and relevant experiences of evaluation.
- (2) Examining  the  valuation  information  provided  by  the  external  professional,  and  reviewing  the reasonableness of the valuation method and assumptions adopted by the external professional.
- (3) Obtaining account records, checking them with the report of purchase price allocation, and the relevant internal and external documents to assess their conformity with the International Financial Reporting Standards and the fairness of management's disclosure of the business combination.

## Other Matter

AcBel Polytech Inc. has prepared its parent company only financial statements as of and for the years ended December 31, 2023 and 2022, on which we have issued an unmodified opinion.
